question_paper.question_paper_name: IIT M FOUNDATION AN3 EXAM QPF3 02 Apr 2023
question_paper.question_paper_description: 2023 Apr2: IIT M FOUNDATION AN3 EXAM 2

questions.question_text_1: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "FOUNDATION LEVEL : SEMESTER 2: ENGLISH 2"  ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN.  (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT ,PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)
question_texts: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "FOUNDATION LEVEL : SEMESTER 2: ENGLISH 2"  ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN.  (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT ,PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)

questions.question_text_1: Scenario I —Interview  [entering the room] Shrinidhi: Hello, Mr. Gunawardene. Hope you are well!  Boss: Hello, Ms. Shrinidhi, I’m well, thank you —please take a seat. How are you doing today? I hope you didn’t have any trouble getting to the right location.  [sitting down] Shrinidhi: I’m doing great, thank you so much! Getting here was quite easy for me —the instructions sent by the HR were very helpful.  Boss: I’m glad to hear that. Well, let’s get started then. Would you like to tell me about yourself?  Shrinidhi: Sure. I graduated last year with a Bachelor’s degree in International Relations from Wellesley College, where I took to the specific field of human rights and international law quite quickly, and then pursued a research internship at the International Justice Organisation.  Since graduation, I’ve been working as a fellow at ThinkAsia, a human rights organisation based out of Singapore. I’ve been looking to get involved in international law for a long-term role after my fellowship is done in four months, which is why I am looking to find work in a legal firm such as yours.  Boss: Great. We are a legal firm —quite different from the NGOs and human rights organisations you have worked with. Then why our firm? What about our firm interests you?  Shrinidhi: I’m interested in the legal work you do for conflict-ridden areas in the Asia-Pacific, especially South Asia. Although I have a human rights background, I want to gain a firm grounding in the legal aspects of human rights, which I hope to do at your organisation.  Based on the above data, answer the given subquestions.
question_texts: Scenario I —Interview  [entering the room] Shrinidhi: Hello, Mr. Gunawardene. Hope you are well!  Boss: Hello, Ms. Shrinidhi, I’m well, thank you —please take a seat. How are you doing today? I hope you didn’t have any trouble getting to the right location.  [sitting down] Shrinidhi: I’m doing great, thank you so much! Getting here was quite easy for me —the instructions sent by the HR were very helpful.  Boss: I’m glad to hear that. Well, let’s get started then. Would you like to tell me about yourself?  Shrinidhi: Sure. I graduated last year with a Bachelor’s degree in International Relations from Wellesley College, where I took to the specific field of human rights and international law quite quickly, and then pursued a research internship at the International Justice Organisation.  Since graduation, I’ve been working as a fellow at ThinkAsia, a human rights organisation based out of Singapore. I’ve been looking to get involved in international law for a long-term role after my fellowship is done in four months, which is why I am looking to find work in a legal firm such as yours.  Boss: Great. We are a legal firm —quite different from the NGOs and human rights organisations you have worked with. Then why our firm? What about our firm interests you?  Shrinidhi: I’m interested in the legal work you do for conflict-ridden areas in the Asia-Pacific, especially South Asia. Although I have a human rights background, I want to gain a firm grounding in the legal aspects of human rights, which I hope to do at your organisation.  Based on the above data, answer the given subquestions.

questions.question_text_1: What does Shrinidhi do, as soon as she enters the interview room?
question_texts: What does Shrinidhi do, as soon as she enters the interview room?

options.option_text: She sits down on the chair.
She waits for the interviewer to greet her.
She stands at the doorway, silently.

questions.question_text_1: What does the phrase “gain a firm grounding” mean?
question_texts: What does the phrase “gain a firm grounding” mean?

options.option_text: Gaining a foundational knowledge in a particular subject
Understanding how to be rooted and humble

questions.question_text_1: How does Shrinidhi make a case for her profile’s relevance in the new company?
question_texts: How does Shrinidhi make a case for her profile’s relevance in the new company?

options.option_text: She talks about her experience at reputed international organisations.
She mentions that she already has substantial experience in the field of law.
She passionately talks about how well she can grasp new concepts, and how itwould be easy for her to move into law.
She emphasises her interest in international law and brings out the connectionbetween law and human rights.

questions.question_text_1: Why does the boss emphasise that they are a legal firm?

Because Shrinidhi’s profile does not show experience in the field of law.
Because he thinks Shrinidhi is too timid.
Because he feels that there are no connections between the field of humanrights and law.

questions.question_text_1: Fill in the blank with the most appropriate modal verb.  For all we know, the new Matrix movie ____________ be interesting. (Strong possibility)
question_texts: Fill in the blank with the most appropriate modal verb.  For all we know, the new Matrix movie ____________ be interesting. (Strong possibility)

questions.question_text_1: In the following sentence, fill in the blank with ‘if’ or ‘whether’. Catch me ______ you can!
question_texts: In the following sentence, fill in the blank with ‘if’ or ‘whether’. Catch me ______ you can!

options.option_text: Either if or whether can be used

questions.question_text_1: Identify the non-finite clause in the following sentence. Maria wanted the student to jump high.
question_texts: Identify the non-finite clause in the following sentence. Maria wanted the student to jump high.

questions.question_text_1: For the direct question ‘Who is that man in the pink shirt ?’, identify a possible embedded question from the options given below.
question_texts: For the direct question ‘Who is that man in the pink shirt ?’, identify a possible embedded question from the options given below.

options.option_text: I wonder who is that man in the pink shirt.
I wonder who that man in the pink shirt is.
I wonder who was that man in the pink shirt were.
I wonder who will be that man in the pink shirt.

questions.question_text_1: Convert the following sentence into passive voice.  Ali gave Siraj a look.
question_texts: Convert the following sentence into passive voice.  Ali gave Siraj a look.

options.option_text: Ali is giving Siraj a look.
Ali will be giving Siraj a look.
A look was given to Siraj by Ali.
Siraj was given a look by Ali.

questions.question_text_1: Convert the following sentence to active voice. The money was counted by the banker.
question_texts: Convert the following sentence to active voice. The money was counted by the banker.

options.option_text: The banker was counted by the money.
The banker will count the money.
The banker is counting the money.

questions.question_text_1: ‘Asoka was a great emperor.’ The interrogative form of this sentence is ___________.
question_texts: ‘Asoka was a great emperor.’ The interrogative form of this sentence is ___________.

options.option_text: Will Asoka be a great emperor?
Did Asoka become a great emperor?
Why is Asoka a great emperor?
